body: Thanks! Great work. Merged in trunk. ✨
Nice catch @charly37!

@pquentin 
Thanks, I have opened defect [LIBCLOUD-976](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LIBCLOUD-976) for this.

Okay, I understand now! As I said on LIBCLOUD-976, If you simply use `cp libcloud/test/secrets.py-dist libcloud/test/secrets.py` without providing your secrets, the tests should run fine: they don't need to access to the actual Google servers. I guess the bug is that providing secrets is breaking the tests.

Thanks @pquentin 
That really helped.
I was putting secrets into libcloud/test/secrets.py hence it was failing.
Closed : https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LIBCLOUD-976

I had to struggle a bit though to know that we need to modify the fixtures json files as the request does not directly go to google.
Finally figured it out and added a test.

Appreciated.
Thanks! Merged in trunk. ✨
It turns out that it's not easy to add a test here, because the fixture will be the same with and without the slash. I decided to merge this as is in trunk. Thanks!

I'm sorry that nobody has looked at this yet, we're lacking reviewers! Something that could help would be to rebase your branch on top of trunk: this would show coverage data. Please consider reviewing other pull requests too. Thanks.

> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/libcloud/pull/1169?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [aaf1574...30f20ac](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/libcloud/pull/1169?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).
@vdloo Good idea, thanks!  On that note, I see that the driver's list_nodes() method doesn't set Node.NodeSize, which would be useful for keeping consumers conformant across drivers.
Just a note, it seems tedious to create a NodeSize, I think I'll have to add a lookup function to get a full NodeSize from list_sizes and a size slug, in my external project.
I 'm willing to help the project. I'll try to review pull requests on familiar drivers at first.
Thanks @zym-ustc! Sometimes the first feedback is to say that lint does not pass (like I did on your PR) or that tests are needed. In those cases, you don't need to be familiar with the drivers.
@vaygr Any help needed to write the test?
@adamwg Why did you close this pull request?
Ah, no, I think I'm good, it just seemed to drop off my list. I'll update the PR shortly.

@pquentin Hi, I must have misunderstood something in the contributor guide.

https://libcloud.readthedocs.io/en/latest/development.html#squash-the-commits-and-generate-the-patch

> Once the changes has been reviewed, all the outstanding issues have been addressed and the pull request has been +1’ed, close the pull request, squash the commits (if necessary) and generate a patch.

I'd be happy to fix this documentation if the workflow is supposed to be something else?
No, sorry, this workflow works fine. I usually take the patch directly from Github, but you're right that this is recommended too. I'll try to apply it this week.

Thanks @adamwight and @vdloo! Merged in trunk. ✨ 

@adamwight Can you please close the JIRA issue? Unfortunately I can't do that myself.
@pquentin @vdloo Thanks for the help!
Sorry, we don't have enough reviewers and it has been forgotten. Do you think you could rebase this on top of trunk? Sorry about this!

Thank you for your contribution!

Unfortunately the test coverage of libcloud/compute/drivers/gce.py is getting lower with the change, but we want it to be higher, so that your changes keep working in the future. As you know, this is important as this is not something that is easy to test in real conditions. See https://codecov.io/gh/apache/libcloud/pull/1144/src/libcloud/compute/drivers/gce.py#L3198 for an example of bad coverage. Thanks.

Hi @pquentin ,
I have added a new test to cover the old path.
Thanks! Merged in trunk. ✨ Can you please close the LIBCLOUD issue? I can't do that myself.
LIBCLOUD issue closed!
I think these are Travis or other issues - I didn't touch what's failing. But I added tests!

@maxlip Thanks. However you do have lint errors:

```
libcloud/test/compute/test_gce.py:847:29: E126 continuation line over-indented for hanging indent
libcloud/test/compute/test_gce.py:864:29: E126 continuation line over-indented for hanging indent
libcloud/test/compute/test_gce.py:881:30: E126 continuation line over-indented for hanging indent 
```

Rebasing on top of trunk would solve the paramiko issue and would allow me to see the coverage easily. Do you think you could do that? Thanks!
Sorry, I realized that the paramiko failure is not your fault. You only have the lint to fix. Thanks.

@pquentin pytest version should also be pinned in this PR
Thanks @tonybaloney, fixed. I'll update the pins of the other test requirements in another pull request if you don't mind.
:+1: Merging

I've rebased. I'm not updating the code since 2016 when I used it for one of my projects.
Let me know if some more work is needed

Thanks! Appreciated.

Can you please fix the lint? See https://travis-ci.org/apache/libcloud/jobs/337021710 and `tox -e lint`.

@biggosh Please make sure tests pass before submitting new commits: see http://libcloud.readthedocs.io/en/latest/testing.html. Lint should pass, you can test this with `tox -e lint`.

Do you have any thoughts about breaking PowerDNS 3.0 ? We should either deprecate the 3.0 API (but it's currently the default version), or only introduce this change for PowerDNS 4.0.

Maybe I found a partial solution not to brake 3.0 compatibility. I don't
have a test environment with it, It will take time to me to prepare one.

In next days I'll solve issues I introduced yesterday night.

wrote:

@tonybaloney, would you mind having a look over this to see if it looks correct to you? I've tested it locally, but another pair of eyes would be appreciated :)

More generally, it may be worth refactoring `_to_image` to take a specific location, rather than a list of locations, and for the driver to internally cache the list of locations for situations where up-to-date locations are not an issue (e.g. unless you need to know datacenter status). But I figured that's a more extensive PR :)
I considered list comprehensions but I was worried the double-square-brackets would look weird. But yeah that makes sense; will fix now.
the filter method is out of fashion nowadays. I recommend the list comprehension. Plate du jour
Done :)
Personally I only target Python 3.x if I can help it, so when I'm contributing to projects that also have to target 2.x I sometimes forget this stuff :-D
I kinda wish Python had an easily-accessible form of `FirstOrDefault()` - you can use something like `next(xxx)` but then you have to deal with `StopIteration` :-/
Oops, sorry, should have noticed the line length thing; I had a wisdom tooth removed this morning and am still a little out of it. Third time's the charm :)
@tintoy tonybaloney/retox :-)
Heh - yeah sorry I normally run the tests (and I think retox is super cool in this regard), just a little vague this arvo and forgot :blush:

> The diff coverage is `100%`.

[![Impacted file tree graph](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/libcloud/pull/1151/graphs/tree.svg?width=650&token=PYoduksh69&height=150&src=pr)](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/libcloud/pull/1151?src=pr&el=tree)

Looks like metadata as before is gone. The os_type is present at the top level, but os_distro is not in the metadata anymore but could also become a top level key like os_type. Haven't implemented that in this PR but maybe that's something for the future. api response looks like this:
```
{u'checksum': u'eb470662a94e5a17fa00bc0e3a674018',

```

```
In [9]: conn.get_image(private_image.id).extra['visibility']
Out[9]: u'shared'
```

I've modified the test so that it would fail without the fix. Although, since we're mocking the network bit it'd fail with a mock error, e.g. `AttributeError: 'GCEMockHttp' object has no attribute '_global_networks_shared_network_for_mig'`.

In reality, and for future reference, it'd fail because it can't find the resource (because it's looking for it in the wrong project), e.g. :

`An exception occurred during task execution. To see the full traceback, use -vvv. The error was: libcloud.common.google.ResourceNotFoundError: {u'domain': u'global', u'message': u"The resource 'projects/project_name/regions/europe-west2/subnetworks/shared_network' was not found", u'reason': u'notFound'}`
